title: Calories in 8 oz Filet Mignon
meta_description: Discover calories in 8 oz filet mignon, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
assumptions: Lean, trimmed beef tenderloin (filet mignon), broiled or grilled to medium doneness, no added fats, salts, or marinades; 8 oz ≈ 227 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, marbling, cooking method, doneness, and source; values are averages—consult labels or a nutritionist for precision.

quick_answer.text: 8 oz cooked filet mignon provides ~406 kcal and ~58 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp butter for pan-searing per 100 g
Untrimmed with visible fat (vs. lean trimmed) per 100 g
Pan-fried in 1 tsp oil per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 8 oz filet mignon?
faqs.a: Approximately 406 kcal for 8 oz (227 g) lean, cooked filet mignon.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 8 oz filet mignon?
Does cooking method affect calories in filet mignon?
faqs.a: Yes—grilling keeps it lower; frying or adding butter/oil increases by 30–50 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: Are carbs present in filet mignon?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars—it's nearly all protein and fat.

faqs.q: How does doneness impact nutrition in 8 oz filet mignon?
faqs.a: Minimal change, but well-done may slightly reduce moisture and concentrate nutrients; stick to medium for standard values.
